title.narrative: Building blocks for a farmer-owned poultry stock feed value chain in Northern Province

description.narrative:
The assessment team advised positively to Agriterra about a cooperation with NPCMU as it has business potential, a large membership and the confidence of supporting stakeholders. The cooperative union has the ambition to expand its poultry stock feed plant to meet demand of its 70,000 members in Northern Province and beyond. BHAG 2018: Clear 2018-2022 strategy and vision for NPCMU, owned by capacitated members and supported by a strong governance structure and financial management system. BHAG 2022: Be the leading poultry stock feed producer in Northern and Muchinga provinces, providing affordable quality poultry feed to farmers. The project will focus on Strategic Planning, Cooperative Governance, Financial Management and Member Strengthening.
Planned activities: Cooperative Governance training: address governance gaps and increase understanding of governance at board and management level. Financial Management training: address FM gaps and increase understanding of FM at board and staff level. Strategic Planning: assist NPCMU in developing a SMART strategic plan guiding its strategic direction towards reaching the 2022 BHAG.My.Coop training to members to strengthen management of the District Cooperative Unions.
Establish a clear long-term strategy and vision that is owned by capacitated members; strengthen governance and financial management.
